text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

Section 36(1) of the Workplace Relations Act 2015 provides that, where an 
inspector has reasonable grounds for believing that a person has committed a 
relevant offence, the inspector may give to the person a Fixed Payment Notice 
in the prescribed form for each of these offences. 

These Regulations prescribe the form of Fixed Payment Notices in lieu of 
prosecution, if appropriate, and the amount of the fixed payment in each case 
in relation to alleged offences under Section 36(1) of the Workplace Relations 
Act 2015 and prescribe the amount of the fixed payment notice in each case in 
relation to alleged offences under subsection (4) of section 4 of the Payment of 
Wages Act 1991, subsection (8) of section 4B, subsection (2) of section 4D, 
subsection (3) of section 4E and subsection (3) of section 4F of the Payment of 
Wages Act 1991 (as inserted by the Payment of Wages (Amendment) (Tips 
and Gratuities) Act 2022), section 6B of the Terms of Employment 
(Information) Act 1994, section 11 of the Protection of Employment Act 1977, 
and section 23 of the National Minimum Wage Act 2000. 

The Workplace Relations Act 2015 (Fixed Payment Notice) Regulations 2015 
(S.I. No. 419 of 2015 and the Workplace Relations Act 2015 (Fixed Payment 
Notice) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 32 of 2017) are revoked. 

1 Insert “subsection (4) of section 4 of the Payment of Wages Act 1991, or 
subsection (8) of section 4B of the Payment of Wages Act 1991, or subsection 
(2) of section 4D of the Payment of Wages Act 1991, or subsection (3) of 
section 4E of the Payment of Wages Act 1991, or subsection (3) of section 4F 
of the Payment of Wages Act 1991, or subsection (1) of section 6B of the 
Terms of Employment (Information) Act 1994, or subsection (2) of section 6B 
of the Terms of Employment (Information) Act 1994, or section 11 of the 
Protection of Employment Act 1977, or section 23 of the National Minimum 
Wage Act 2000”. 

2 Insert details of the nature of the offence 

3 Insert the relevant amount as prescribed under Regulation 4 of the Workplace 
Relations Act 2015 (Fixed Payment Notice) Regulations 2023 

4 Insert the name of the Inspector duly appointed under Section 26 of 
the Workplace Relations Act 2015
